turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: That's better than gold when it's cold.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Thank you.  Tell me -- what do those words mean? "Beloved husband"... "Beloved son"... "Beloved wife"...

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: My father was the husband and my mother was the wife. "Beloved" is a word they used -- to stay together.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Stay? They lived together all their years?

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I know...  We're going to try and get in this way. I don't think you can make it.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Oh... I did so look forward to seeing all those people.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Logan-5... Francis-7, authorized duty quadrant. Intrusion accidental.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: I don't know who you are. I'd like to thank someone.

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: It doesn't matter who we are. Follow the tunnel to the end.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: Will there be someone to tell us where to go from there...?

turns.speaker: VOICE
turns.text: Someone will follow. When you come to the lock, he will tell you how to go on the other side. Jessica may go with you as far as the lock.

turns.speaker: LOGAN
turns.text: No. Jessica goes back now. Take her back.  Now! Go on back. Back outside, Jessica.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Well? How do you like it?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: I don't know. The cheeks maybe... look a little --

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Cheeks? Cheeks? Right. Too much, you think?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Too little?  Too little. Okay, wait for me.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: No -- just there -- on the first level.  Don't look for us. We'll see you.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: You don't seem quite sure, Jessica.  Can you do it? Will you?

turns.speaker: "V"
turns.text: Good... You up for a drive?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Where to? Hey, Lanie, I heard you were out of it for a while, too.

turns.speaker: "V"
turns.text: Just goin' up'ta "Tops"... Maybe the "Ten Pin".

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: This rod is a fuckin', embarrassment, Carl. Whatiya burn in this thing, "V"?

turns.speaker: "V"
turns.text: You gotta be kiddin'... This is the boulevard... You can't hear yourself think.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Do you always sleep here?... In this room?... Both of you?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I like to remember things my own way.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: What do you mean by that?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: How I remember them. Not necessarily the way they happened.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: It kept going off for some reason. False alarms.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I forgot. Anyway, I hate the idea of acting paranoid.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: The angle. The high angle shot on the tape.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Do you own a video camera?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: No, one of us is always here to let the maid in. Nobody else has a key.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: We'll see that the patrol of the house is doubled.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I don't know if I want to stay here. I don't feel safe.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: How'd the camera get so high like that?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: And smooth... Almost no movement - back and forth, I mean.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Like you'd get if it was hand held.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Might be a good time to try using it again.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Anybody else have a key to the house.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: We'll keep a watch on the house.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: If anything else happens, you'll call us.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: You don't remember being awakened? It looks like you were aware of someone.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Has anyone made any threats to either of you recently?

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: Now we'll see what this son of a bitch is up to.

turns.speaker: AL
turns.text: We've got Pete Dayton's prints all over this place.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: There's no such thing as a bad coincidence.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: How would you like to take me to dinner?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Okay, then, I'll take you to dinner.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Where's your phone? I have to call another taxi.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Yeah... Call me at home. I'll give you the number.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I have to go somewhere with Mr. Eddy.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I think he suspects something... We have to be careful... I miss you.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Meet me at the Starlight Motel on Sycamore... I'll be there in twenty minutes.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm not positive... but... he knows.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: We should stop seeing each other.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No, honey... It was part of the deal.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: He makes films for Mr. Eddy.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: How'd you get in with these fuckin' people?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: It was a long time ago... I met someone at this place called Moke's... we became friends. He told me about a job...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: No... A job... I didn't know what. He set up an appointment for me to see a man.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: If you want me to go away, I'll go away.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: That's his name... Andy. Our ticket out of here.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'll set it up for tomorrow night. You'll meet me at his place at eleven o'clock... Don't drive there... Take a bus... Make sure no one follows you... His address is easy to remember... It's 2224 Deep Dell Place... It's a white stucco job on the south side of the street... I'll be upstairs with Andy... The back door will be open... That leads into the kitchen - go through the kitchen to the living room - there's a bar there... At eleven fifteen, I'll ask Andy to fix me a drink... When he does, you can crack him in the head... Okay?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Lemme call him now. Make sure he's not already busy tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Why are ya goin' so early?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: 'Cause that's how long it's gonna take, baby.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What if Andy tips off Mr. Eddy?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Are you kidding?... I've got so much on Andy, it isn't funny.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What about tonight?... Whatiya gonna do about Mr. Eddy tonight?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: I'm not goin' home tonight... I'm goin' somewhere else...  To a girlfriend's house.  But, we still have a coupla things to take care of...

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Are you gonna be a man about this, Pete?

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: We gotta get the stuff and get out of here.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Up the stairs - down the hall.

turns.speaker: ALICE
turns.text: Look at all this shit... I know a fence... he'll give us money and get us passports in exchange for this and the car...  We can go anywhere.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: I don't know his name. He's a friend of Dick Laurent's, I think.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: But Dick Laurent is dead, isn't he?

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: He is? I didn't think you knew Dick. How do you know he's dead?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I don't. I don't know him.

turns.speaker: ANDY
turns.text: Dick can't be dead. Who told you he was dead?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Wonderful!!... Wonderful to see you, Pete. How are you?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Feeling good, Arnie. Ready to get to work.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Wonderful, Pete. Really wonderful. Alotta people Pete... alotta people are gonna be very happy.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Mr. Smith has been waiting for you and Mrs. Trueworthy. Can you take care of Mr. Smith now?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Mr. Eddy's called every day... Can I call him to come in?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Sure, Arnie. Bring 'em on, I'm ready.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Arnie called this morning while you were sleepin'. They miss you pretty bad down at the garage. I told 'im you still had a "fever".

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Nice to know they can't seem to get along without ya.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You really don't remember the other night, do you?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: The night before you showed up in the slammer...

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Goin' out with these clowns for a while.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: I gotta headache... What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: They wanted to know if we'd had a chance to find out what happened to you the other night. They wanted to know if you remembered anything.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: But I don't remember anything. What did you tell 'em?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Yes, there was a man with you... She brought you here... She didn't know what else to do.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: What is this? Why didn't you tell me? What?... I don't remember any of this.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Never saw him before in my life.

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: Did you tell the police this?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: We're not saying anything about that night to the police. We should all forget that night.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: A cell that was supposed to be occupied by an inmate named Fred Madison.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: His condition? What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Same as always. Pete takes care of himself.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Have you made any charges against him?

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Then he's coming home with his mother and me.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: All right... but you see our predicament... Legally we can't hold him, but he may be able to help us... perhaps later.  For now, he's free to leave.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: Just rest easy, Pete. You're gonna be okay.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: Are you hungry, honey? I'll fix you something.

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: We saw you that night, Pete.

turns.speaker: BILL
turns.text: You came home. Your friend Sheila brought you here.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: Warden, it's not him. It was not Fred Madison in that cell.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Of course, it's Madison!!! Who else could it be?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: I don't know. The guards say they've never seen him before.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: He's in the infirmary, being examined.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Did you ask him who he is?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: He... He can't talk. it appears as if he can't talk, anyway.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: If he's not Madison, then where's Madison?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: I've got men searching the building and the grounds now.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: How about Madison? Have we had even a hint of his whereabouts?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: Nothing, Marsh. Vanished. There's an APB out on him. His photo's been faxed nationwide.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: One of the guards must have leaked it.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: What's the word on the street?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN HENDERSON
turns.text: You just gonna let him go?

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: We'll get a tail put on him.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY MACK
turns.text: I'm not entirely certain, Captain. You'll have to see for yourself.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY MACK
turns.text: I couldn't say, sir... Captain Henderson?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY MACK
turns.text: Captain... this is some spooky shit we got here.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: You say you haven't seen your son since the day before yesterday?

turns.speaker: CLAIRE
turns.text: When he went to work, right.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Yes, and we need to talk to him... if we can.  Mel, let's get Peter in here.

turns.speaker: WARDEN
turns.text: Pete, can you tell us now, anything about this?

turns.speaker: PETE
turns.text: No... I don't feel so good. I would like some aspirin.

turns.speaker: DR. ROGOFF
turns.text: He's just been fingerprinted, and I'll run these blood tests right away. We'll find out soon enough.

turns.speaker: DR. ROGOFF
turns.text: I examined Madison last night, Marshall. He had a headache.

turns.speaker: DR. ROGOFF
turns.text: I did a routine once-over, and gave him a sleeping pill. I've never seen this man before. Neither have the guards. I don't think he's in the system.

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: DO YOU KNOW HOW MANY FUCKIN' CAR LENGTHS IT TAKES TO STOP A CAR AT 35 M.P.H.?

turns.speaker: MR. EDDY
turns.text: SIX FUCKIN' CAR LENGTHS... THAT'S ABOUT A HUNDRED AND SIX FUCKIN' FEET, MISTER! YOU WERE FOLLOWING TEN FEET BEHIND ME... IF I'D HAD TO STOP SUDDENLY, YOU WOULD HAVE HIT ME. I WANT YOU TO GET A DRIVER'S MANUAL, AND I WANT YOU TO STUDY THAT MOTHERFUCKER... AND I WANT YOU TO OBEY THE GOD DAMN RULES. FIFTY FUCKIN' THOUSAND PEOPLE WERE KILLED ON THE ROAD LAST YEAR.  CAUSE OF FUCKIN' ASSHOLES LIKE YOU. TELL ME YOU'RE GONNA GET A MANUAL.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: I'll get a manual.  and study it.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Let's have a look at the hallway outside the bedroom.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: No... There is, I mean, I use it as a practice room... it's soundproofed.

turns.speaker: ED
turns.text: Did you use the alarm system since we were here last?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: The first night... Not the last two.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Headache, huh? Too much sun, I guess. You want to come in?  Still got forty- five minutes outside if you want it.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: No, no. I want to go in.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: The pain is getting worse. I need more aspirin.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: I can't give you anymore. I'll talk to the doctor.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Aspirin... fly head. I gotta have more aspirin.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: The doctor said not to give you anything. You can see him in the morning.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I don't think so. Where was it that you think we've met?

turns.speaker: MYSTERY MAN
turns.text: At your house. Don't you remember?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: No, no I don't. Are you sure?

turns.speaker: MYSTERY MAN
turns.text: Of course. In fact, I'm there right now.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: What do you mean? You're where right now?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: You don't mind that I'm not coming tonight?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: What are you going to do?

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: I thought I'd stay home and read.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: It's nice to know I can still make you laugh.

turns.speaker: RENEE
turns.text: Wake me up when you get home.
